intro: Rhaponticoides lachnopus, commonly known as the mountain buckthorn, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and dark, glossy berries. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with a fine pubescence. The berries are an important food source for birds and small mammals in its native habitat.
